alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 6:01PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tulare County through 630 PM PST... At 601 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Three Rivers, or 21 miles northeast of Porterville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Three Rivers, Hockett Meadow Ranger Station, South Fork Campground, Oak Opening, Case Mountain, Quinn Patrol Cabin and Wet Meadows. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra
